variables.description:
Boolean if the themed toolbars should be included. A themed toolbar
just has a different background color based on the `$md-light-theme`.

Boolean if the prominent styles should be included for toolbars. This
really just makes a toolbar with a bigger height.

Boolean if the very small styles for flat or raised buttons in toolbars
should be included.
Boolean if the styling for text fields in toolbars should be included.

Boolean if the styles for autocompletes in toolbars should be included.
This really just updates the autocomplete's menu to span the entire viewport
on mobile devices.
Boolean if the select field styling in toolbars should be included.
The amount of margin for an inset toolbar.

context.name: react-md-toolbars

see.description: The default z index for fixed floating buttons
The z-index to use for fixed navigation drawers.

The z-index to use for menus
type Number
The z-index to use for snackbars.

context.name: react-md-toolbars

variables.description:
The toolbar's prominent title font size. This will only be included if it does not equal the
`$md-title-font-size` variable.

context.name: react-md-toolbars
react-md-toolbars

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description:
Boolean if the toolbars should be themed
    for the light theme.

parameter.name: include-media
parameter.description:
Boolena if the toolbar media queries
    should be included.

parameter.name: include-themed
parameter.description:
Boolean if the themed toolbars
    should be included.

parameter.name: include-prominent
parameter.description:
Boolean if the prominent
    toolbar styles shoudl be included.

parameter.name: include-btn-text
parameter.description:
Boolean if the flat or raised
    button styles in toolbars should be included.

parameter.name: include-text-fields
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles for
    text fields in toolbars should be included. If the params `include-autocomplete` or `include-select-fields`
    are `true`, this will always be included.

parameter.name: include-autocompletes
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles
    for autocompletes in toolbars should be included.

parameter.name: include-select-fields
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles
    for select fields in toolbars should be included.

usedBy.description:
Includes every component, transition, and typography including their
media queries if the `$md-media-included` variable is `true`. You can
modify any global variables before including this mixin to change the overall
theme.

context.name: react-md-everything

mixins.description:
Updates the toolbar's `themed` color ONLY if the `$light-theme` does not equal the
`$md-light-theme` and the `$include-themed` param is `true`.

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description:
Boolean if the toolbars should be themed
    for the light theme.

parameter.name: include-themed
parameter.description:
Boolean if the themed toolbars
    should be included.

usedBy.description:
Updates the styles of every component with the new theme colors. If there
are components that do not change if the `$light-theme` variable is the same,
their updated styles will not be included. This is useful if you want to switch
between the light or dark theme, or even the entire theme colors while keeping
the base css the same between all themes.

In addition, if the theme colors do not switch, those styles will not be created.
So this allows the same colors between light and dark themes.

If you switch between the light and dark theme, you will need to give a `$html-class-name`
That will nest every component inside.

context.name: react-md-theme-everything

mixins.description: Includes the styles for toolbars on mobile devices. This should normally be used in a media query.

context.name: react-md-toolbars-mobile
